bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, September 21, 1922

div1.p: Russell encloses a letter from Selskar M. Gunn reporting on yellow fever in French West Africa.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, September 21, 1922
div1.opener:
I. H. B.
Africa
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
WICKLIFFE ROSE
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
F. F. RUSSELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR OF
PUBLIC HEALTH LABORATORIES
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
HERMANN M. RIGGS
WALLACE BUTTRICK
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
FREDERICK T. GATES
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
September 21, 1922
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am sending you for your information a
copy of a letter just received from Professor Sel-
skar M. Gunn, the Board's Director in France, with
reference to the cases of yellow fever in French
West Africa.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell
Acting General Director Doctor Henry R. Carter
Assistant Surgeon General
U. S. Public Health Service
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington
D.C.
